title: 104_s1165
content: The "Fairness for Adopting Families Act" allows for a tax credit for adoption expenses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Fairness for Adopting Families Act" allows a tax credit against the tax imposed for qualified adoption expenses paid by an individual, with limitations of $5,000 and a reduction based on income exceeding $60,000. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. No credit is allowed if expenses are deductible elsewhere or if funds are received from government programs. Reimbursements for expenses are also not eligible for the credit. Unused credits can be carried forward. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. Unused credits can be carried forward for up to five years. Qualified adoption expenses include reasonable and necessary fees directly related to the legal adoption of a child. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. Qualified adoption expenses do not include expenses related to the adoption of a spouse's child. Married couples must file joint returns for this tax credit. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. Qualified adoption expenses do not include expenses related to the adoption of a spouse's child. Married couples must file joint returns for this tax credit. The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1995. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. Gross income of an employee does not include amounts paid by the employer for qualified adoption expenses under an adoption assistance program. The tax credit for adoption expenses is limited to $5,000 and reduced for income over $60,000. An adoption assistance program is a plan where the employer provides adoption assistance to employees, meeting specific requirements. Adoption reimbursement programs for armed forces or Coast Guard members are considered adoption assistance programs. Qualified adoption expenses are defined for this purpose. The amendments made by this section regarding adoption assistance programs and cross-references to other Acts will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1995.
